ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How often does/do your child/you fall asleep or get drowsy during class periods?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often, Frequently; 4 = Very often, Always

ElementDescription: How often does/do your child/you get sleepy or drowsy during class periods/doing their/your homework?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often, Frequently; 4 = Very often, Always

ElementDescription: Is/Are your child/you alert most of the day? (reverse score)
Notes: 4 = Never; 3 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 1 = Often, Frequently; 0 = Very often, Always

ElementDescription: How often is/are your child/you ever tired and grumpy during the day?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often, Frequently; 4 = Very often, Always

ElementDescription: How often does/do your child/you have trouble getting out of bed in the morning?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often, Frequently; 4 = Very often, Always

ElementDescription: How often does/do your child/you fall back to sleep after being awakened in the morning?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often, Frequently; 4 = Very often, Always

ElementDescription: How often does/do your child/you need someone to awaken him/her/you in the morning?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often, Frequently; 4 = Very often, Always

ElementDescription: How often do you think that your child/you needs more sleep?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Seldom; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often, Frequently; 4 = Very often, Always
Sum of p_pdss_1 through p_pdss_8; Higher scores are associated with reduced total sleep time, poorer school achievement, poorer anger control, and frequent illness
